title: As Aid Trickles Into Syria, Residents Say Too Little, Too Late
description: “Some people under ruins are sharing their wills with the team,” said one rescue worker. “They share names of their loved ones, then they die.”

title: Your Friday Briefing: 20,000 Dead in Turkey and Syria
description: Also, new U.S. information about China’s spy balloon and North Korea’s newest missile.

title: Pink Floyd’s Roger Waters Weighs In on the Russia-Ukraine War, Again
description: An address at the United Nations this week is dismissed by an American ambassador.

title: Elon Musk Won’t Let His Starlink Satellites Run Ukraine’s Drones
description: The comments angered some leaders in Kyiv.

title: Earthquake in Turkey and Syria One of
description: The death toll surpassed 20,000 on Thursday, a grim milestone that makes it among the deadliest since 2000.

title: Earthquake in Turkey and Syria One of
description: The death toll surpassed 20,000 on Thursday, a grim milestone that makes it among the deadliest since 2000.

title: South African President Declares ‘State of Disaster’ Over Power Crisis
description: President Cyril Ramaphosa, facing rising public wrath, on Thursday declared a “state of disaster” and pledged to end an energy crisis that threatens economic and political stability.

title: In Turkey, a Parking Lot Becomes an Open-Air Morgue After Earthquake
description: Hundreds of families searched for deceased relatives at a makeshift morgue outside a hospital in Turkey’s hardest-hit region.

title: Church of England Considers Gender-Neutral Language for God
description: The church said that God was neither male nor female and has asked a commission to explore how that is reflected in its services.

title: ‘Not Just a Silly Balloon’: Dismay and Fear Over Another U.S.-China Clash
description: A big white orb has pushed the rival superpowers back to diplomatic distance, showing that peace may be frighteningly fragile.

title: First Significant Aid Arrives in Northwestern Syria After Quake
description: The U.N. convoy was carrying shelter material and non-food items to the opposition-held region.

title: Russia’s Wagner Mercenary Group Says It Has Stopped Recruiting Prisoners
description: Thousands of released convicts have been killed, many soon after arriving on the battlefield in Ukraine, Russian rights advocates and Ukrainian officials say.

title: Zelensky presses Ukraine’s case in Brussels, the third stop in a brief but packed European tour.
Nicaragua Frees Hundreds of Political Prisoners to the U.S.
description: The authoritarian government of Daniel Ortega handed over 222 prisoners as a way to signal a desire to restart relations with the United States, according to officials.

title: Chinese Balloon Had Tools to Collect Communications Signals, U.S. Says
description: China’s surveillance balloons have flown over more than 40 countries and are directed by the Chinese military, the State Department said.

title: A Fight Against Sludge
description: Why the Biden administration is trying to crack down on those sneaky fees charged by hotels, rental cars, internet providers and more.

title: Live Updates: First U.N. Aid Reaches Northwestern Syria Since Earthquake
description: A humanitarian convoy crossed from Turkey into opposition-controlled Syria on Thursday, three days after the devastating quake. The death toll in the region passed 17,000.

title: Europe’s Leaders May Have Little to Give as Zelensky Presses His Appeals
description: The Ukrainian leader plans to meet the European Union’s 27 heads of government Thursday in Brussels, where the topic of more sanctions against Russia could be on the table.

title: What China’s Military Balloons Show About Its Spying Ambitions
description: Chinese military scientists have been looking for ways to make them more durable, harder to detect and even to serve as platforms that fire advanced weapons.

title: Life on the Beat for Ukraine’s Cops: The Drunk, the Disorderly and Drones
description: In cities dealing with bombardment and blackouts, the Patrol Police have taken a lead in trying to retain a sense of security for a traumatized public.

title: Freed Guantánamo Prisoner Has Big Dreams for a New Life in Belize
description: Majid Khan, a “high-value detainee” at Guantánamo Bay, was released last week after two decades of social isolation.

title: Can China Reverse Its Population Decline? Just Ask Sweden.
description: Wealthy countries have been trying to boost their birthrates for decades. The results have been pretty similar.

title: U.S. Aims to Curb Investment in China Amid Security Concerns
description: The Biden administration is preparing new rules that would restrict U.S. dollars from flowing to China.

title: Kizzmekia Corbett Unlocked the Science of the Covid Vaccine
description: Kizzmekia Corbett helped lead a team of scientists contributing to one of the most stunning achievements in the history of immunizations: a highly effective, easily manufactured vaccine against Covid-19.

title: North Korea Urges ‘Preparedness for War’ and Displays New Missile
description: Analysts said the new weapon was probably a solid-fuel ICBM, which the North’s leader, Kim Jong-un, has wanted to add to his country’s growing nuclear arsenal.

title: He Set Off Across Australia on a Toy Scooter. Then Australia Got on Board.
description: An improbable journey by a Japanese visitor chronicling his adventures on social media has captured the country’s imagination.

title: Rebuilding Quake-Stricken Cities in Turkey and Syria May Take Decade
description: While intact buildings might look fine, their structural integrity might have been damaged. Some of these buildings will have to be torn down. This process alone could take years.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: The latest from rescue efforts in Turkey and Syria.

title: An Underground Hospital in Syria Fills With Quake Victims
description: A subterranean hospital known as the Cave and long the destination for war wounded is now filled with casualties of the earthquake — both alive and dead.

title: Turkey-Syria Earthquake: Millions Await Aid While Suffering Cold and Grief
description: With thousands dead and many more left homeless in Turkey and Syria, people struggling to unearth victims, bury the dead and provide for millions of survivors are pleading for more aid.

title: Visiting U.K. and France, Zelensky Pleads for Jets and Weapons for Ukraine
description: In a surprise visit that started a two-day blitz of Western allies, the Ukrainian president implored Britain to provide planes he said would represent “wings of freedom.’’
